oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Portrait of Cpl. John W. Morgan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Portrait of Cpl. John W. Morgan, Co. D., Walker's Battalion, Thomas' Legion. His Confederate forage cap has lettering "T. L." for his legion. The trim on the coat is distinctive. Thomas' Legion had a mixture of Cherokee and white soldiers from N. C. and Tennessee. Born in 1844, Morgan enlisted in 1862 and died of typhoid fever at home in Strawberry Plains on July 24, 1863.
